column4: If I upgrade my Jaunty Ubuntu am I going to end up losing my added repo's?
Normally not. Only if you had added very exotic repositories which Ubuntu does not take care of.
I added repos based on ubuntu, but not directly built by such.
So you will not loose them.
Nice, thanks. Also was wondering if you might be able to take a gander at an error im receiving on trying to DL packages from console?
A 'gander' is a bird. I do not know what you mean. Can you say it in other words, please.
Could you take a look at the error im receiving on ubuntu's pastebin and see if you may know what is causing this?
Yes. Go ahead showing me the pastebin.
Thank you. http://paste.ubuntu.com/430398/
First do '~$ apt-get autoremove'. Second, what is 'autoscan'? It is no Ubuntu package.
It's from the BT4 repo's I believe
What does 'BT4' stand for?
BackTrack4, I get the same error on apt-get autoremove
What tool do you use to install and deinstall Ubuntu packages?
It's a sec distro. I used the synaptic package manager with their repo. and I usually use sudo apt-get install, or the synaptic manager if I don't know the package name
I am using the Synaptic package manager too. --  I am sorry but I cannot help you with Backtrack 4 and any problems it might produce.
Understandable. Think it will be an issue if I upgrade? or cause an issue rather?
Having read your http://paste.ubuntu.com/430398/, I am afraid, yes.
That kinda sucks, oh well, guess ill just have to wait to the end of my semester when i can turn my laptop into a full linux machine
In the mean time you might consider to get rid of Backtrack 4. --  Good luck.
Indeed...
Thanks for your time and considerations
Enjoy ubuntu!
Always do. It's a great OS
